item.title: Buttigieg, Booker Lead Midterm Democratic Health Care Push
item.description: Pete Buttigieg argued that pressure from Wisconsinites had led their Republican congressional representative to vote in support of extending enhanced health care subsidies. ]]>

item.title: Winter Storm Brings Snow and Cold Temps as Far South as Florida and Georgia
item.description: Snow falling early on Sunday morning at a Hyundai dealership in Pensacola, Fla. Snow was also falling in parts of Georgia. ]]>

item.title: Josh Shapiro Writes That Harris Team Asked if He Had Ever Been an Israeli Agent
item.description: A new memoir by Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania goes into detail about his experience being vetted to be former Vice President Kamala Harris’s running mate in 2024. ]]>

item.title: In Minneapolis, a Pattern of Misconduct Toward Protesters
item.description: Federal agents hold down a protester outside the Whipple federal building in Minneapolis on Jan. 11. ]]>

item.title: Before Urban Raids, Border Patrol Tested Tactics in California Farm Country
item.description:
Just before President Trump took office, Border Patrol agents led by Gregory Bovino arrested immigrants in Kern County using the same playbook later seen in places like Chicago and Minneapolis. Then a federal judge ordered them to stop.

]]>

item.title: Texas Schools Wait as Law on Ten Commandments Reaches Appeals Court
item.description: On Tuesday, the 17 active judges on the generally conservative Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals in New Orleans will hear arguments over the Texas state law mandating the display of the Ten Commandments. ]]>

item.title: Inside Minnesota Hospitals, ICE Agents Unnerve Staff
item.description: Hennepin Healthcare in Minneapolis on Sunday. ]]>

item.title: What to Know About M.L.K. Day
item.description: Martin Luther King Jr. in Washington on Aug. 28, 1963, the day of his “I Have a Dream” speech. ]]>

item.title: Search of Reporter’s Home Tests Law With Roots in a Campus Paper’s Suit
item.description: The search of the home of a Washington Post reporter last week may be another turning point in arguments over press freedom. ]]>

item.title: Prominent Catholic Clerics Denounce U.S. Foreign Policy
item.description: Cardinal Blase Cupich said in an interview that, among his fellow cardinals, there was “a sense of alarm about the way things were going in the world.” ]]>

item.title: Trump’s Trade Negotiator Says Response to Court Loss Would Be Immediate
item.description:
If the Supreme Court rules against its tariffs, the Trump administration would begin replacing them immediately, said Jamieson Greer, the United States Trade Representative.

]]>

item.title: Elon Musk Spends $10 Million to Help Nate Morris in Kentucky Senate Race
item.description: Elon Musk at the Kennedy Center in November. After his falling out with President Trump last year, he has inched back toward the Republican fold. ]]>
